definition: to let down with a rope
"silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall

sentences.english: 25But his followers took him by night and lowered him in a basket through an opening in the wall.
sentences.chinese: 他的门徒就在夜间，用筐子把他从城墙上缒下去。

sentences.english: Then the disciples took him by night and let him down through the wall in a large basket.
sentences.chinese: 他的门徒就在夜间用筐子把他从城墙上缒下去。

sentences.english: Then the disciples took him by night, and let him down by the wall in a basket.
sentences.chinese: 于是他的门徒就漏夜用大篮子把他从城墙上缒下去。

definition: to walk on tiptoe/to walk quietly/to tread (on)/to follow
an article made of bamboo strips/fence
to draw a bow to the full/the range of a bow and arrow/old variant of 夠|够[gou4], enough
pot-scrubbing brush made of bamboo strips/basket (container) for chopsticks/variant of 筲[shao1]
ancient weapon with a tip shaped like a hand or claw
